{"courseCampus-bod":{"whatSetsCampusApart":{"01":"<0>Job Opportunities</0> 
With 4,700 companies and 22,400 jobs, Bordeaux is one of the leading cities in France in terms of job growth in the digital sector. Thanks to the financing options available in France, many people have joined Ironhack and started their careers in tech. The new job market is more digital than ever, and the tech industry is booming. The moment to start a new career is now!","02":"<0>One of the most attractive cities in France</0> 
Did you know that with +1.5% of growth per year, Bordeaux is one of the most attractive cities in France? Bordeaux has many assets including its incredible architecture (classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site); its ease of travel by bicycle or public transports; its privileged geographical location (proximity of the ocean); its dynamic student life and its wonderful heritage (world capital of wine!). Plus, the actual living cost is lower than in Paris, so you literally and figuratively get more out of life if you decide to settle down here!","03":"<0>The startup city of the West Coast</0> 
Did you know that Bordeaux has a very lively and growing startup scene, with many new businesses in the tech industry? Thanks to the awarding of the FrenchTech label in 2014, the digital sector has expanded! This digital scene is driven by the dynamism of an entire ecosystem strongly mobilized around the FrenchTech Label. With 4,700 companies and 22,400 jobs, Bordeaux Metropole is one of the leading regions in terms of job growth in the tech industry, and this is just the beginning! Many digital companies are setting up shop in Bordeaux and recruiting!","04":"<0>Financing options in Bordeaux</0> 
Life after COVID-19 is not the same. Since the beginning of the pandemic, there has been a rise in new job openings and most people need support to get the necessary skills to take advantage of these new opportunities. Our goal is to make learning tech skills more accessible to everyone. If you need help financing your plunge into tech, there are flexible financing options available for you."}}}

{"courseCampus-lon":{"whatSetsCampusApart":{"01":"London has been named the Silicon Valley of Europe because of its mature tech clusters and it  being home to some of Europe‚Äôs top tech companies. From early-stage startups to IPOs, there is a great environment for firms to grow - attracting talent from around the world. The digital sector in the UK is a real success story as it accounts for 7.7% of the GVA - the value of goods and services produced in an area, industry or sector of an economy. It is not surprising that such a mature economy offers a wide range of opportunities for up-and-coming talent to grow and develop their careers in tech.","02":"Over the past years the need for digital skills has made some of the top consulting firms work with the government to build initiatives and schemes that will help and encourage people to take part in the digital economy. This sector employs 2.98 million people representing 10% of all jobs in the UK. As our digital economy is accelerated by factors such as Remote working, there is the potential for more than three million jobs to be created by 2025.","03":"From creative industries to financial services, technology is becoming a focal point to develop all over the country. London itself is a capital for fintech where most of the global financial services are located. The investment in technology keeps growing, helping new and scaling companies grow and hire more people in tech. All these factors along with the surgance of remote working have helped people from all over the country work in companies based in London, with the opportunity to develop other areas. Starting salaries range from ¬£30K/year upwards with average salaries of ¬£60K and above.","04":"This is the right time for people in London and all over the UK to take the leap into tech."}}}
